body_html:
Hi,

I recently had issues compiling BoringSSL because the -Werror complier flag was set in the BoringSSL build. If your error log is complete, it looks like the same warnings that were tolerated in building other parts of the code, were treated as fatal errors in the BoringSSL build.

If the -Werror flag is your problem, it would be best to find where it is set. However, I used a brute force solution to get the job done.

find . -type f -not -regex ".*\.\(o\|h\|c\|a\|t\|cc\|so\)" -exec sed -i -e "s/-Werror/-Wno-excessive-errors/g" {} \;

You are compiling on a Mac, so you may want to add "bundle" to the exclusions regex.

The fact you are getting these warnings may indicate that you have a new version of the compiler that is now complaining about things that previous versions did not (that was my case), or an older version of the tool chain that truly might not know how to do what the flags are requesting be done. Particularly, in the newer toolchain case, getting rid of -Werror is a solution.

Hope this helps.

body:
Hi,

I recently had issues compiling BoringSSL because the -Werror complier flag was set in the BoringSSL build. If your error log is complete, it looks like the same warnings that were tolerated in building other parts of the code, were treated as fatal errors in the BoringSSL build. 

If the -Werror flag is your problem, it would be best to find where it is set. However, I used a brute force solution to get the job done.

```bash
find . -type f -not -regex ".*\.\(o\|h\|c\|a\|t\|cc\|so\)" -exec sed -i -e "s/-Werror/-Wno-excessive-errors/g" {} \;
```

You are compiling on a Mac, so you may want to add "bundle" to the exclusions regex.

The fact you are getting these warnings may indicate that you have a new version of the compiler that is now complaining about things that previous versions did not (that was my case), or an older version of the tool chain that truly might not know how to do what the flags are requesting be done. Particularly, in the newer toolchain case, getting rid of -Werror is a solution. 
 
Hope this helps.
